By DAMIEN CAVE
and ADAM RASGON and ADAM RASGON JERUSALEM - With Israeli

rael's government has found itself
confronting more vocal discontent from an important constituency: its own military leader Current and former senior milimore openly that because the gov mornment has failed to roll out plan for what follows the fighting in Gaza, Israeli troops are being

the war- to battle aagain for areas
of the territory where Hamas

of the war cabinet were of the war cabinet were especially
fustrated with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu for failing to develop and announce a process
for building an alternative to Hamas to govern Gaza.
There was little There was little expectation ew government would be formed while combat raged. But "clear,
old and build" is the widely accepted practice for fighting an insurgency. And to a growing num ber of critics, Israel appears to b
imply stuck in clearing simply stuck in clearing mode, in-
creasing the risks for Israeli soldiers and Gazan civilians while

ed. The two officials said Mr. Ne tanyahu's unwillingness to have a latter phases of the Gaza camdaign - the "day after" the fight
